New Records: Endrick became the youngest male player to score an international goal at Wembley at 17 years and 246 days
Key Match Events: Endrick scored the winning goal for Brazil in the 80th minute
Lucas Paquet√° hit the post in the 35th minute
Anthony Gordon had England's best opportunities
Endrick was through on goal in the dying seconds but Pickford saved with his feet
Pre-Game Insights: England was missing captain Harry Kane and other regulars
Brazil gave debuts to five players in their starting 11 due to injuries to key players
Gareth Southgate opted for an attacking line-up as he prepared for Euro 2024
Post-Match Reflections: Gareth Southgate said 'it was a brilliant moment' for Endrick but said his defenders had failed to deal with the danger
Southgate said he was happy with his team's performance overall
Southgate mentioned that the difference in the end was one moment, and that is the ruthlessness of football at this level
Miscellaneous Highlights: Endrick is due to join Real Madrid from Palmeiras
Real Madrid trumped other top clubs to sign Endrick
Endrick's goal was his first for Brazil
The match was a friendly between England and Brazil
The attendance was 83,664 at Wembley Stadium
